thread.title: Co-working space to open on Mass Ave.
thread.title_full: Co-working space to open on Mass Ave.

author: indystar.com
title: Co-working space to open on Mass Ave.
text:
Coworking space Industrious, shown here at its Atlanta location, announced it would launch in Indianapolis on Mass Ave. (Photo: Submitted by Industrious)
130 CONNECT TWEET 3 LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE A hospitality-focused co-working company will open a two-level, 18,000-square-foot workspace inside Mass Ave.'s new development: The Marietta.
New York-based Industrious announced Friday it will open its first Indiana location in September at 350 Massachusetts Ave.
Industrious promised in a news release to work with "notable tenants from startups to enterprise companies" in 70 to 80 private offices for small companies up to eight people. Monthly memberships fees will be $450 a person and includes office space and use of common areas such as conference rooms, outdoor terraces, fiber internet, printing, mail services and more. Members will have access to the space 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
The workspace will occupy more than half of the 30,000-square-foot space inside The Marietta. Construction on the building will be complete in the spring, and Kimbal Musk's farm-to-table restaurant The Kitchen will fill 5,000 square feet on the ground floor. The Marietta's building management company, Gershman Partners , will occupy the fourth floor of the building.
Industrious launched in 2013 and has locations in 11 cities throughout the U.S., including Chicago, Minneapolis, Nashville, Tenn., and Atlanta.
 Amy Bartner at (317) 444-6752. Follow her on Facebook , Twitter and Instagram .
